title: why  i always looking for peer ..............................issue
body:
hii everyone 
i need your help to resolve the issue . i run this command 
geth --datadir ./ --syncmode 'full' --port 30311 --http --http.addr '0.0.0.0' --http.corsdomain "*" --http.port 8502 --http.api 'personal,db,eth,net,web3,txpool,miner' --bootnodes 'enode://cbfac53734a50f26d9653bd60ee9547f335bda404f35e1ae17517bcffe867d1d7f3965fd14f1da8036d440afc2a1408ac0e503c0495b11d6af4d01c5f1b7e284@127.0.0.1:0?discport=30301' --networkid 1111 --miner.gasprice '1' --allow-insecure-unlock -unlock 0x280e68978816a30b0d10d4980b0cca2fb7772412 --password password.txt --mine --miner.etherbase 0x280E68978816a30b0d10d4980b0CCa2fB7772412 --maxpeers=10


after that i stuck   NFO [03-21|14:35:28.917] Looking for peers                        peercount=2 tried=0 static=0

It looks like you are running a private network? How many nodes did you set up in your private network? 
Geth will log `Looking for peers` if you have less than 3 peers. If you only have three nodes on your private network, you can just ignore this message
